meanings.definition: A person who starts a business with little capital or resources.
meanings.sent1: The bootstrapper opened a small bakery with just a few ingredients and a lot of determination.
meanings.sent2: The bootstrapper launched her online store with only a laptop and a dream.
meanings.sent3: The bootstrapper tried to start a lemonade stand with just a single lemon - it was a sour start!
meanings.sent4: Like a bootstrapper in the wild west, she built her business from the ground up.
meanings.sent5: The image of the bootstrapper pulling themselves up by their bootstraps is a symbol of resilience.

meanings.definition: A self-reliant individual who achieves success through their own efforts.
meanings.sent1: The bootstrapper fixed the broken fence all by himself, showing his independence.
meanings.sent2: She was a true bootstrapper, never relying on others to reach her goals.
meanings.sent3: The bootstrapper decided to build a treehouse without any help - it was a lofty goal!
meanings.sent4: Just like a bootstrapper in a fairy tale, he overcame obstacles with his own strength.
meanings.sent5: The story of the bootstrapper who climbed the mountain alone inspired many to pursue their dreams independently.
